annotation.TEXT: Okay, first off, I just remembered to show this. If you pause with no spell equipped, you get this message (just like when you pause with no ability in many Kirby games).
Moon count: 3
Good thing I still have my Mini spell!
So, yeah, that was dumb of me. However, I'll use this opportunity to get a Ball medal before entering that side area again, just so I can do something fun...
You CAN kill them?! I did not know that! And, you get a bunch of coins for doing so as well! I guess I just never pummeled them enough in the demo!
Watch out for these birds. They'll deploy smaller birds in your direction.
Hmm... There's a 1-up down there, but how do I reach it?
Oh, what could that be? Well, let's try smacking it with my staff! But first, I've gotta toss out one of my spells... Well, I paid good money for this Sword, so... bye, bye, Ball!
Welcome to the Kwik-E-Mart! Okay, so you can buy spells for use within this level here. We've seen Fire and Thunder before.
Switch back and forth between your spells as necessary here to either deal with enemies or get through small passages.
Thank you, come again!
Ehh... We don't need no stinkin' blue switch to get up to the door here.
Alright, let's resume our adventure with 1-3!
DOUBLE KILL!
Now, up ahead, I see something familiar that I've encountered before in Amapani! But first, let's smack some rabbits (but not the friendly rabbits that give advice).
This one flying enemy here can dip slightly into this lower area, so I'll just shoot him down now.
Alright, here... we... GOOOOO!!!!!
Aw, only 10 coins...
So, remember the Ball ability from Kirby's Adventure? This is sorta just like that. You can jump higher and move faster with it, and you can also easily fly out of control!
Okay, this is going to make getting the moon much easier than how I did it in the demo, since I had somehow overlooked this Sniper spell in the shop there.
DOUBLE DOUBLE KILL!
Now, Sword is new, and I guess I can spare 20 coins to show it off. Also, there's Sniper here? I think I somehow overlooked that one when I played the demo.
Yeah, it was painful, but I survived the trip, and I was able to hit the green switch with the Magical Arrow using a low-power shot that went into a downward arc.
Oh, joy!
Aww... 10 coins again?
Pfft. Okay, the AoE isn't quite that generous.
Pfft... LOL. Jammed coin count: 1
D'oh! Well, it's okay, as there's a heart right there.
Breathtaking. I shall call her... "Mini-Me".
Alright, let's repeat the level and get that moon.
Well, I don't plan on getting a Game Over. (Also, I don't plan on dying either, but we'll see how that goes.) Okay, so let's ride this line-guided platform over the spikes here.
Whoa, careful. Okay, I've got a new spell here-- Ball!
DOUBLE KILL!
Huh, there's a green time limit switch down there. I wonder how you reach that? Well, I'll worry about it later.
Yeah, at the end of the previous episode, my file's playtime happened to stop exactly on 13:37, which I thought was neat.
Ooh, lots of coins there.
Yeah, being little has its uses. Huh, what's with the "\" just below the word "little" there?
Yep, we've got these time limit switches in this game too! However, just touching them won't actually activate them here. You have to actually strike them with an attack.
BTW, in the demo, since I'd overlooked the Sniper spell in the shop, I went for the Magical Arrow further on, then ate damage to return across the spikes.
And here we have a shop, but first, there's these large round guys to deal with. If you strike them with your staff, you won't kill them, but you will still get a spell!
Hey there everyone, and welcome back to... this game! So, I'm starting the recording from the title screen just to show something real quick.
DOUBLE KILL!
Alright, I have what I need!
Huh. For some reason, I was thinking Magical Arrow when I saw Sniper there, but this is quite different. You hold the button down, move the cursor, then release to fire.
Whoa, careful. I was trying to just bounce straight to that upper ledge, but I don't want to lose control and fly into the pit by accident.
Okay, so it should be obvious what to do here. First, snipe the green switch, then switch to Mini and drop down while holding right.
BTW, Tobari can duck in this game, unlike the protagonists of Amapani. However, you can't simply duck-slide into this gap here. You need the Mini spell for that.
However, you can just switch spells or discard Minimum to instantly grow back up if you need to. Also, I don't think the attack button does anything while you're mini.
Whoa, geez. I do not want to fall into that pit by accident. Okay, to disable this effect, either switch to the other spell slot or discard the Ball medal.
BTW, the moon is on the lower path there, but I wanted to show the upper path first. I'll redo this level for the lower path and the moon eventually.
Okay, I'm gonna go get that heart up there to heal the damage I took earlier, and then I'll check out that shop.
Of course, that's obviously not the intended solution. Simply buying Sniper at the shop is definitely the way to go.
For right now, I'll just purchase the Sword medal. It'll appear just outside of the shop, so be sure to pick it up.
Yep, press the Magic Cancel button (which is called "Remove Magic" in the Key Config) to poof that spell back into a medal, which I showed off in the last episode.
And there's the goal!
DOUBLE KILL!
Yeah, if only there was a way to become smaller, but sadly, I don't have such an ability right now.
Ah, but Mini-Me was able to get the jammed coin. Cool. And, of course, now that I've got the Mini spell, I can go down here to get this 1-up!
Master combo! (7 hits) And then a well-timed Magic Cancel before I destroy the Mini spell!
MULTI KILL!
BTW, as far as I know, these large creatures that give you the Ball spell are totally invinc-- WHAT?!
Alright, let's buy this Sniper spell here...
Wait, this is different from Magical Arrow...
Alright, that's it for all of the levels I've played in the demo. Starting next time, I'll be playing totally blind! To be continued... Yo!
Alright, now I can Omnislash things! ...Okay, not quite, but I can do a 3-swing combo, with the 3rd swing being a rising slash!
I'll also need the Mini spell, so I'm going to head on over to that side area now.
Alright, now I remember there being a door in the upper-left over here, so I'm going to check that out next. Oh, and you can strike the switch with any attack to activate it.
I apparently stomped that one. Also, I'll just ignore the lower enemies that don't pose a threat.
Huh, for some odd reason, you can't change magic spells while you're in midair while Mini. However, you can do a midair change from another spell.
The area of effect of the Sniper shot seems to be pretty decent.
Oh, what? That dude got off a tiny bit of ice as I delivered the whack there? Oh, geez. I'd better be more careful.
DOUBLE KILL!
DOUBLE KILL!
BTW, if you switch off of Mini while you're in a narrow passage, the game will just shove you out one way or the other (favoring the direction you're facing away from).
MULTI KILL!
And now we're back here. Now, just like with the Mini Mushroom in the New SMB games, I cannot harm enemies with my normal stomp while I'm minimized.
Wait, don't disembark too soon. There's an easy 1-up to get right here. After that, race forward and smack at least one of the archers up ahead quickly, before they fire.
...Wait...
You can also bowl over enemies with it, which is fun. Just be very careful with where you're bouncing. Also, I don't believe the attack button does anything with this spell.
I don't need that heart right now, so I'll just leave it there. Also, I think the sides of the spikes hurt you, just like in SMW, so try not to even brush up against them at all.
Be careful of that slippery ice there when going for that 1-up.
Oh, no... Did I seriously forget to show the Sword magic's pause menu description? Argh... Remind me to show off both that and the Broom magic's description next time.
DOUBLE KILL!
DOUBLE KILL!
Jump over this tiny gap, because Tobari can't simply run over it while Mini (although she can just run over single-tile gaps while big).
Oh, I know this song! It was used in Amapani's underground levels! Anyway, I'd like to chat with this friendly Rabbit, but not while this duder over here is flinging fire my way.
...Did I really just do that? D'oh... Also, an ice-blocked enemy will simply disappear after a few seconds if you don't knock the block away with another attack first.
DOUBLE KILL!
